posts.title: Getting Started with Web Development
posts.body: Web development is an exciting field that combines creativity and logic. This post introduces the basic tools, languages, and mindset required to start your journey as a web developer.

posts.title: Understanding HTML Semantics
posts.body: Semantic HTML improves accessibility and SEO by giving meaning to web content. Learn how elements like header, article, and section help structure your pages correctly.

posts.title: CSS Flexbox Made Simple
posts.body: Flexbox is a powerful layout system in CSS. This article explains how flex containers and flex items work together to create responsive layouts.

posts.title: Mastering CSS Grid Layout
posts.body: CSS Grid allows you to design complex layouts with rows and columns. Discover how grid-template-areas and fractions simplify page design.

posts.title: JavaScript Basics for Beginners
posts.body: JavaScript adds interactivity to websites. This post covers variables, functions, and events to help beginners understand core concepts.

posts.title: Understanding the DOM
posts.body: The Document Object Model allows JavaScript to interact with HTML. Learn how to select, modify, and respond to elements dynamically.

posts.title: Introduction to ES6 Features
posts.body: ES6 introduced modern JavaScript features like arrow functions, let and const, and template literals that make code cleaner and more readable.

posts.title: What Is React and Why Use It?
posts.body: React is a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces. This article explains components, JSX, and why React improves development speed.

posts.title: Setting Up a React Project with Vite
posts.body: Vite provides a fast and modern development environment for React. Learn how to set up a project and understand the folder structure.

posts.title: Understanding React Components
posts.body: Components are the building blocks of React applications. This post explains functional components and how to reuse them effectively.

posts.title: Props vs State in React
posts.body: Props and state control how React components behave. Learn the difference and when to use each for managing data.

posts.title: Handling Events in React
posts.body: Event handling in React is similar to JavaScript but with JSX syntax. This article shows how to manage clicks, forms, and inputs.

posts.title: React Router for Beginners
posts.body: React Router enables navigation between pages without reloading. Learn how to use Routes, Route, and Link components.

posts.title: Managing Global State with Context API
posts.body: The Context API helps share state across components. This post explains providers, consumers, and practical use cases.

posts.title: Fetching Data in React
posts.body: Fetching data from APIs is essential for modern apps. Learn how to use fetch and useEffect to load data efficiently.

posts.title: Using JSON Server for Mock APIs
posts.body: JSON Server allows you to create a fake REST API quickly. This article shows how to set it up using a db.json file.

posts.title: CRUD Operations Explained
posts.body: CRUD stands for Create, Read, Update, and Delete. These operations form the backbone of most web applications.

posts.title: Styling React Apps Effectively
posts.body: Styling React apps can be done with CSS, CSS Modules, or libraries. Learn best practices for maintainable styles.

posts.title: Debugging Common React Errors
posts.body: Debugging is a crucial skill. This post covers common React errors and how to fix them efficiently.

posts.title: Deploying a React Application
posts.body: Deployment makes your app accessible online. Learn how to deploy React applications using popular hosting platforms.
